title: How to Drain a Hot Tub Easily Using a Drain Garden Hose

steps.title: Connect the hose to the water bib (that's the faucet on the side of your house).
steps.content: Connect the hose to the water bib (that's the faucet on the side of your house). Put the open end into the hot tub, and start filling the hot tub. The idea here is to fill the hose with water completely, with minimal air bubbles in the line. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Once you've got flow into the tub, turn off the water at the hose bibb.
steps.content: Once you've got flow into the tub, turn off the water at the hose bibb. Keep the hose end in the hot tub submerged, or you'll have to refill the hose with water! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Bend a kink into the hose a couple feet below the connection to the hose bibb.
steps.content: Bend a kink into the hose a couple feet below the connection to the hose bibb. This seals the water inside the hose, more or less. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Disconnect the hose from the faucet.
steps.content: Disconnect the hose from the faucet. You'll have to hold the kink in the hose until you get the tail end (the end you're holding) below the level of the hot tub. This is where gravity comes into play. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Once you've got the end you're holding (still kinked) below the level of the hot tub, and you're in your pre-selected location for where you want the water to go, let the end of the hose un-kink.
steps.content: Once you've got the end you're holding (still kinked) below the level of the hot tub, and you're in your pre-selected location for where you want the water to go, let the end of the hose un-kink. The water will start flowing. You've just created a siphon! [5] X Research source Water "seeks its own level", which is how this system works. The water pressure in the hot tub essentially pushes the water out the hose, because the open end of the hose is lower than the level of the water in the hot tub. Yes, the water has to go up and over the edge of the tub, but here's the neat part––because the hose was full of water, the water inside the hose creates suction at the end inside the tub, which pulls the water over the edge, and flows down the line.

steps.title: Remove the water.
steps.content: Remove the water. Wipe down and dry the hot tub and store/cover as suggested by the manufacturer.
